intro: Damapana africana, commonly known as African damapana, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shrubland and woodland areas, often in well-drained soils. The leaves are usually simple and opposite, with a slightly hairy surface.
